reviewText: All of the shows that he made were wonderful. He was a wonderful actor and he is missed dearly. RIP Peter
The Columbo series represented the best in TV entertainment. The episodes are timeless, always great to watch. Too bad there are no reruns on TV right now.

The sixth episode of this second season, A STITCH IN CRIME, was broadcasted on Feb. 11st, 1973. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Second Season. This is the second Columbo episode directed by Hy Averback after Columbo: Suitable for Framing. It's also the second time that Anne Francis appears in the serie after her role as Valerie Bishop in Columbo Collector's Edition: Short Fuse. In this episode, Lt. Columbo must investigate the murder of a nurse who was about to denounce Dr. Barry Mayfield. Mayfield (Leonard Nimoy), during a surgical operation, had sewed with a wrong suture the aortic valve of his colleague Dr. Edmund Hidemann (Will Geer) with the hope that Hidemann would die a few days later. Two scenes of A STITCH IN CRIME will undoubtedly stay in my memory. Firstly, the scene showing the effects of a drug injection on Harry Alexander's mind and, most of all, Columbo's fit of anger against Mayfield. This was the first time we could watch Columbo losing his temper. A VHS to keep in your library.

Excellent episode, Columbo takes on Leonard Nimoy. This episode is about a brilliant surgeon who goes bad. As usual with Columbo episodes this one has superb writing and excellent acting.
This is one of the best "Columbo" TV movies ever produced. It has a great cast, especially Leonard Nimoy as Dr. Mayfield, and the plot and storyline keep you interested throughout. Very well done.

Fantastic.  Columbo takes on Leonard Nimoy, who plays a malicious cardiac surgeon.  The murder is inventive and diabolical. There are numerous scenes to enjoy in this one, especially Columbo's arrival at the scene of the  crime, wherein he shells his hard boiled egg on the murder weapon!
